name: Jynx

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Merely by meditating, the Pokémon launches a powerful psychic energy attack.

description: Jynx is a unique Basic Psychic-type Pokémon that combines coin flip mechanics with damage scaling based on the opponent's current damage. With 70 HP and no evolution, Jynx serves as a standalone attacker that can adapt to different situations - using Doubleslap for early game chip damage or Meditate to finish off wounded opponents. The damage-scaling mechanic makes Jynx particularly effective in the mid-to-late game when opponents have accumulated damage counters.
competitiveHistory: Jynx saw significant competitive play in the Base Set era, particularly in Haymaker-style decks where it served as an excellent cleanup attacker. The combination of 70 HP, low energy requirements, and Meditate's scaling damage made it a valuable inclusion in aggressive strategies. Tournament players appreciated that Jynx could be played immediately as a Basic and could punish opponents who were carefully managing their resources to avoid knockouts. While not a top-tier threat on its own, Jynx was a solid supporting attacker that found its way into many successful competitive decks.

rulings.ruling: Meditate does 20 base damage plus 10 additional damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon. For example, if the Defending Pokémon has 3 damage counters (30 damage), Meditate does 20 + 30 = 50 total damage.
